headline: Biden and the State of the Midterm Elections
author: Karl Rove
sentences: It had high moments, as Democrats and Republicans alike stood to applaud when the president introduced the Ukrainian ambassador and told an impressive story about the West’s response to Russian aggression.
The State of the Union address is what historian Daniel Boorstin called a pseudo-event, a speech endowed with special meaning because of its pageantry and pervasive news coverage.
Gallup has found that since 1978, the State of the Union has led to just an average 0.4-point improvement in a president’s approval rating.

President Biden’s speech Tuesday was typical of the genre.
Such addresses rarely have a big impact on public opinion.
